body.p: This topic contains information about how you can reference videos from your HTML or XML documents.Only Acrobat Reader supports video embedding.

For HTML, the video tag can be used without any other styling in your CSS files:... <video data="path/to/video.mp4" format="mp4" width="480" height="270"> <source src="path/to/video.mp4"/> </video> ...
It is recommended to use absolute paths for data and src values like this: src="file:/C:/absolute/path/to/video.mp4".
Both width and height attributes are optional. If they are not set, the video size will be extracted from its properties.

section.title: Customize Video Cover Placeholder
section.p: By default, a placeholder is displayed in place of the video. When clicked, this placeholder will launch the video.
